Beard Envy and Lucette should be given to the players listed on the cards before the game starts.  Some folks find these two cards can be rather harsh on the starting player when combined but Prolific games thinks they should put on their big boy pants and earn that beard they were so proud of before these cards.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Priority Supplies Battlefield Expansion
Description:
Bring your battlefield to life with the twelve new objective miniatures introduced in the Priority Supplies Battlefield Expansion for Star Wars: Legion!

Here, you'll find an assortment of comms stations, vaporators, and crates that you can use to mark objectives or simply use as terrain to decorate your battlegrounds. As these miniatures reshape the physical surface of your battles, three new battle cards give you new options for objectives, deployment, and conditions. With the miniatures and cards in the Priority Supplies Battle eld Expansion, you can reshape your games of Star Wars: Legion and enter the Galactic Civil War like never before.

Name: Opowieści z Karczmy: Elfów
Description:
This is an expansion for the OpowieÅ›ci z Karczmy.

In this expansion you will find 10 cards, 30 new Threads and the new Elves' Leading Theme.

Remember, beauty and art sometimes go hand in hand with shooting skills!

Name: Thronestorm
Description:
Thronestorm is a game of deep strategy for two players, condensed into an intense ten minutes where each game is different and every move counts. Portable and quick to learn, it’s perfect for cafés, train journeys, and lunch breaks.

Develop your influence across a constantly shifting realm by claiming powerful relics belonging to one of ten noble houses, all while making subtle maneuvers to thwart your opponent’s plans.

Each relic you hold allows you to manipulate the position of other relics in regions controlled by the corresponding house. These areas of influence themselves change as the relics move, and often overlap with those of your opponent.

The first player to unite a matching set of four relics wins the game, but as you consolidate your power over one house, your control over the realm diminishes. Dance effortlessly from one alliance to another while quietly establishing your dominance over the realm, until your opponent can do nothing but watch helplessly as you seize the throne!

The crystal staff from the wizard’s college, an enchanted lute from the bard’s guild, the cutlass of the pirate king, or the black knight’s helm; the deck of relics consists of forty cards, each an original painting by legendary artist Sam Ballard.

—description from the publisher

Name: Opowieści z Karczmy: Goblinów
Description:
This is the expansion fot the OpowieÅ›ci z Karczmy.

In this expansion you will find 10 cards, 30 new Threads and a new Goblins theme.

Remember, the best stories are those about failures. Someone else's failures.

Name: Opowieści z Karczmy: Magów
Description:
This is an expansion for the OpowieÅ›ci z Karczmy.

Inside you will find 10 cards, 30 new Threads and a new Theme -  Magicians.

Remember, sometimes the fireball works just as well as a quick escape!

Name: Opowieści z Karczmy: Nikczemników
Description:
This is an expansion for the OpowieÅ›ci z Karczmy.

Inside you will find 10 cards, 30 new Threads and a new Theme of the Fretless.

Remember, sometimes the villain can be a hero.

Name: Coastal Patrol
Description:
Found in Too Fat Lardie's Summer 2011 Special magazine.

This is a set of rules that attempts to simulate the actions fought by coastal patrol craft from the English Channel to the Pacific Ocean. Most of the actions involved small craft armed with automatic weapons and torpedoes attacking other patrolling coastal forces as well as supply convoys and small war ships. Most of the actions took place under the cover of darkness since stealth and surprise were vital to the survival of these small craft.

This is not a game for large capital ships or huge fleets. The game is designed to allow each player to assume the command of a handful of small boats in order to refight the type of actions that were typical of the coastal action fought throughout the war.

Ideally these rules are used with 1/600th or 1/1200th scale models. Any Naval game will come with a whole host of data for the ships and vessels involved, and this set is no different.

To keep this piece to a manageable size the publisher has deposited all such data in the Files section of the TooFatLardies Yahoo Group.

Name: ブックメイカーズ (BOOK MAKERS)
Description:
Publisher's summary
é€±åˆŠå°‘å¹´æ¼«ç”»ã®ãƒˆãƒ¼ãƒŠãƒ¡ãƒ³ãƒˆç·¨ã®å„ªå‹ã‚­ãƒ£ãƒ©ã‚’äºˆæƒ³ã—å½“ã¦ã‚‹ï¼

User summary
In the game of ãƒ–ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ¡ã‚¤ã‚«ãƒ¼ã‚º (BOOK MAKERS), there is a manga, a Japanese comicbook magazine named "Shukan Shonen Boardgame (Weekly Boys' Boardgame)", and a comic strip named "BOOKMAKERS" is the most popular in the magazine. Its story is heating up, and the most climactic event is about to begin: The Tournament Battles!

In this game, players are readers of the manga "BOOKMAKERS". The player who has been most excited at the manga wins the game. The game is published in the same format as 'Weekly Shonen Jump', a very popular weekly manga in Japan. The designer is publishing under his own label ÅŒtsuka seisaku (ã‚ªã‚ªãƒ„ã‚«è£½ä½œ) outside of his other work with KUA. The doujin publisher Gyunbuku-ya (ãŽã‚…ã‚“ã¶ãå±‹) is listed for design work on the game, not strictly as the game publisher.

There are nine competitors in the tournament. At the beginning of the game, each player is randomly assigned a competitor as their favorite character. Players take turns placing a competitor to form a tournament bracket. Then players secretly choose who will be the champion of the tournament.

There are eight battles in the tournament. Most of a battle proceeds automatically, and rough probability of victory is calculated easily. But before the battle begins, players have some chances to place a fan letter face-down on a competitor to modify the result toward their favor.

Here are how you get excited (score victory points).
1) You score points when your favorite character wins a battle, and ultimately, you score big points when your favorite character wins the tournament. 
2) Each competitor has a destined rival. You score points when your favorite character fights with their destined rival. Win or lose doesn't matter. 
3) For each battle, you score points if you have correctly predicted who will win the battle. 
4) You score points if you have correctly predicted the champion of the tournament.

The player with the highest total wins the game.

Name: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game: Expansion 4 – Dead Ends
Description:
This expansion includes two new player decks. First is Jared Kincaid, one of the deadliest mercenaries in the paranormal world of the Dresden files. Second is Mortimer Lindquist, an ectomancer, meaning he has the power to communicate and interact with ghosts.

It also includes new book decks for books 12 and 13 of the series, Changes and Ghost Story.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Marching Cats
Description:
In the memory game The Marching Cats (ãƒã‚³ã®ãƒžãƒ¼ãƒ), you start the game by playing out the cards face down on the table. The deck consists of black, green, and gray cats (six each), blue and red cats (three each), golden cats (four), and eight music notes.

On a turn, you reveal a card, then stop and collect that card or reveal another card. If you reveal a type of card that's already been shown, then your turn ends, you collect nothing, and all revealed cards are laid face-down again. If you stop before this, you collect the revealed cards except for a revealed note card, which is turned face down again. If you collect a blue and red cat, thereby reuniting the lovecats, you score 2 points; if you collect a pair of matching cats, you score 1 point. Golden cats are wild and can be paired with any color. You cannot use the same blue cat to score for both lovecats and a pair.

The first player to score 8 points wins. You can do this solely by collecting cats, but another possibility is to start your turn by saying "Note atsume" ("Collecting notes), then reveal only note cards — which are worth 1 point each — until you have a total of 8 points between cats and notes, thereby winning the game; if you flip anything other than a music note (i.e., a cat), your turn ends and you must hide those notes once again, while giving the cat card to the player on your left. Hope you didn't make them win!

Name: Redneck Life: Livin' the Dream
Description:
Livin’ the Dream Expansion will give you more Rigs, Homes, all new charts, Go Redneckin’ Cards, name chart and score sheet pad... all of the amazing pieces and parts to be Livin’ the Dream!

Livin' the Dream is an expansion for Redneck Life Board Game by Gut Bustin' Games. This is not a stand-alone game. In this fun-filled Expansion for Redneck Life Board Game, we have included a Score Sheet Pad, 20 New Rigs, 10 New Homes, 50 fun-filled Go Redneckin' Cards, Rig Sleeve, All New Charts, and a new Name Placard for the center of your existing game board! Be the player with the most teeth remaining to win this Gut Bustin' Game Expansion for Redneck Life! Play Redneck Life Board Game with the Livin' the Dream Expansion for a Gut Bustin' Great Time!.

—description from the publisher

Name: Phreaker Life
Description:
Welcome to the world of Phreaker Life. A deck building, card trading game taking you back to the 1970 to 1990 phreaking and hacking era; with some twists.

The deck you acquired is mostly incomplete. You can attempt to complete your deck by trading cards with other Phreakers. They may be kind and donate to your cause willfully. You both may consent to a fair trade. Ideally, you will both desire to battle in The Stream for the card(s) you need. Winner takes the spoils.

Why does a complete deck matter? Look at the back of the deck. Do you see it? The art...it's incomplete. Complete the art, find the puzzles and capture the flags.

Inspiration
The game Phreaker was inspired to provide the CypherCon 3.0 attendees a fun set of puzzles, with the option to have something they can continue using and collecting long after CypherCon 3.0 has ended. A byproduct of the game's inspiration is to use all proceeds from the sale of decks at the Midwest Gaming Classic and other conferences to support the Hak4Kidz NFP charity.

Many hours, people, and scrapped ideas went into creating what we hope dials you up into the exciting world of phreaking and hacking that was the two decades from 1970 to 1990.

Time to get your phreak on. Not your hobby...your life.

—description from the designer

Name: Santorini: Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack contains:
– 1 x Eris god card
– 1 X Maenads god card
– 1 X Castor & Pollux god card
– 1 X Proteus god card
– 1 X Tyche god card
– 1 X Scylla god card

The rules for these gods are only available online.

-description from publisher's website
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Eldenia: Counterattack of Asmodians
Description:
Counterattack of the Asmodians began.
Devil Kartu and his colleagues came back to regain their lost power.
You will venture into the world of Eldenia with the more powerful Asmodians.

Devil Kartu pains his opponent and raises his abilities.
Black Knight Tamil is able to maximize his attack power while suffering himself.
Pickpocket peter can steal your opponent's abilities.
Blacksmith Chakram has an ability to turn gold into a sword's offensive power.

Newly appeared monsters are powerful. However, you can make your ability more powerful.
Those new items are powerful and dangerous. You must pay attention to its use.

Stronger interaction makes it difficult to predict who will win.
Win the victory while blocking the opponent with various abilities.
The game became more difficult with more injuries and fatalities than before.
But do not worry. A healer may appear soon.

—description from the designer

Name: The City of Kings: Jamba Costume Promo
Description:
A promotional card originally given out during the 2018 No Pun Included Kickstarter campaign.

This promo introduces a new equipment card to the game and is part of the Promo Card: Costume Pack which includes all four Costume promotional cards.

Equiping this item will increase both attack and heal, along with health and worker movement making it a truly multi-role item.

Name: The City of Kings: Okol Costume Promo
Description:
A promotional card originally released at UK Games Expo 2018.

This promo introduces a new equipment card to the game and is part of the Promo Card: Costume Pack which includes all four Costume promotional cards.

Equiping this item will increase both attack and heal, along with health and worker movement making it a truly multi-role item.

Name: Shipwrights of the North Sea (Second Edition)
Description:
The second edition of the game contains both the first edition base game, plus the Townsfolk Expansion in the same box.

Shipwrights of the North Sea is set in the early years of the Viking Age, circa 900 AD. As Viking shipwrights, players compete to build the greatest fleet on the North Sea. Players must collect oak, wool and iron, as well as getting other craftsmen on board to help. Gold is a precious commodity, and must be spent wisely. As you would expect, the township is filled with an array of characters, bad and worse. Better hope they're on your side!

Aim of the Game

The aim of Shipwrights of the North Sea is to be the player with the most Victory Points at the game’s end. Points are gained by constructing various Ships and Buildings. The game ends after the round where 1 or more players constructs their 4th ship.

Gameplay Overview

The game is played over a series of days (rounds). Each day follows the same pattern:

Morning Phase - Planning (Each player receives 3 cards)
Afternoon Phase - Working (Players take actions and play or discard their 3 cards and use one action on the central Village board)
Evening Phase - Resting (Players receive Gold and Workers for the next day)

Printed Components

128 Cards - Featuring 46 unique and stunning illustrations
5 Beautifully Illustrated Player Boards
5 Player Reference Boards
1 Illustrated Rulebook
1 The Townsfolk Expansion Rules Sheet
1 Pioneer Token
5 VP Markers
1 Village Board
5 Shield Tokens

Wooden Components

5 Gold Ships
25 Oak
25 Wool
25 Iron
50 Workers
Families: Series: The North Sea Trilogy (Garphill Games)

Name: Color Dice
Description:
Playing time: 5-10 minutes per player. Unique use of dice drafting determines how many of your pawns that will move or strike pawns of the other player(s). Win by placing all your 9 pawns in the home area of any other player.

For a 2 player game, use 2 dummy players of other colors, and for a 3 player game, use 1 dummy player.

Place your pawns only in the areas of real or dummy players. Dummy players do not roll the dice, but they may counterattack if their dice show a higher value than that of the active player. Pawns of dummy players do not enter the board again after being struck.

Name: Mini BrilliAnts
Description:
The long, hot summer is coming to an end, and the ant colonies in the quiet forest glade are increasing their efforts to prepare for the coming winter. Queens are hatching ants to grow their colony’s population, Farmers and hunters are scouring the area to stockpile food, and diggers are excavating tunnels to extend their colony’s territory. Will you be able to fulfill your colony’s harvesting objectives? Will you be able to beat enemy ants to the glade’s dwindling resources? Will you be able to avoid the dreaded predators? Will you lead your colony to victory? Will you be the most BrilliAnt?

On their turns, player either play an ant, play a predator, or hatch a new ant in order to be to most effective. Players battle over the same objectives, so be sure to look out on what your opponents are doing. The game ends when a player has completed their sixth objective or when there are no more resources to collect.

Mini BrilliAnts is an ant-based card game playable in 15 minutes, a resource-collection game for 2 to 4 players in which the goal is to complete objectives to score the most victory points. The player whose objectives are worth the most points will win this small euro-style game!

—description from designer

Name: Master of Wills: Shadowcell Expansion Faction Deck
Description:
As mercenaries and vigilantes, Shadowcell takes the law into their own hands using deception and the art of surprise. They hide their intentions and set traps for their prey. Shadowcell is clearly more advanced in their methodology and with the right leadership, they may ultimately be unstoppable.

Shadowcell is the faction of the night. They are the secret whisper around every corner and the blurred movement down each alley. As mercenaries and vigilantes, they take the law into their own hands using deception and the art of surprise. Shadowcell is clearly more advanced in their methodology and with the right leadership, they may ultimately be unstoppable.

—description from the publisher

Name: Street League Sluggers
Description:
Family friendly 2 player baseball game that uses a dueling dice rolling system. Draft your team, set your line up and outwit your opponent in this fast-paced 2 player game.

Each player will take turns drafting players from a pool of 30 character cards, until they have filled their team. Each team will draft 9 batters and 3 pitchers each in any order they choose. You will need to set your lineup for your batters 1-9 and decide on which pitcher you will use to start the game.

Each game is only 3 innings long. This is to keep the games shorter, kid friendly and gets you quicker into the next game. (We suggest you pitch a new pitcher each inning however, in advanced games you can play a full 9 inning game. In those cases it's suggested you pitch a new pitcher every 3 innings)

All players have a special power that can be activated when they roll a Crush/Dominate on their die roll while batting/pitching. This power often gives that character a huge advantage during that at bat to succeeded or in the pitchers case to get the batter out.

Pitching & Hitting 
Once you set your lineup and selected your pitcher, the game starts. Home team will pitch first and the visiting team will bat first. The goal of the pitcher is to get the batter out, either by strike out or through the contact deck in which the batter can hit into an out. The batters goal is to make contact with the pitch and draw from the contact deck to get a hit. Each player will pick one of the 3 colored dice that stand for each of the types of pitches in the game. The dice have numbers ranging from 1-5 and 1 CRIT Side. Both players pick 1 die to roll and then roll at the same time, then check the results. The Pitcher gets a +1 to their die roll if the batter did not match the pitchers colored die. This is for not guessing the right pitch in the at bat. However if the batter does match the pitch color they would receive the +1 to their die roll. If the batter meets or exceeds the pitchers roll they make contact with the ball and draws a single card from the hit deck. If the Pitcher exceeds the batters die roll the batter receives 1 strike. On 3 strikes the batter is out. If either player rolls the CRIT Side, that character activates their own power. It's often a hit for the batter and a strike for the Pitcher automatically but with card manipulation along with it.

The Hit Deck has 50 cards and it's filled with automatic hits like: Home Runs, Triples, Doubles and Singles. There are also Contact Play Cards where it's hit out into the field and the pitchers team must successfully make a play on the ball or the batter gets a hit. Not to forget the dreaded automatic outs as well as foul balls. Many special powers allow you to draw multiple cards from the contact deck to give you the best chance at getting on base.

Game components:
30 Beautifully designed players, 24 Hitters with 6 Pitchers.
50 Card Hit Deck.
6 Colored Dice Pitching & Hitting: Fastball, Curveball & Changeup.
2 Standard D6 for Fielding.
10x10 Playmat.

-description from designer

Name: Micro-Football: Weather Expansion
Description:
Micro-Football: Weather Expansion adds the elements to your micro football experience! Swap out the perfect grass field from the base game and play on a muddy or snowy field. You can also make your normal, Rainy Day, or Snowy Day more difficult by adding in a Windy Day. Each of these new weather conditions can have an impact on triggering a Big Play, gaining yards, and kicking Field Goal's.

Components

9 cards (4 muddy football field, 4 snowy football field, 1 rules card)

A copy of Micro-Football is needed to play this expansion.
-description from designer

Name: Glyph: Destruction Dice
Description:
Tucked away in the corner of the tribe’s archives, a dusty tome has been discovered. In it, scholars have come across what had only been legend: a new method of harnessing the power of the glyphs. Why had this tome been hidden away? Unfortunately, the scholars learned the answer to their question much too late, and cursed they ever found the tome…

The Glyph of Destruction is a new glyph in the land of Tundrus. This glyph, as the name suggests, is not to be trifled with. The new method of harnessing the glyphs has remarkable power: Players are able to generate doubles of any glyph they desire with ease. But such power comes at a cost. In rare instances, the method doesn’t generate the desired glyph, but instead forms an entirely new glyph. A glyph that eradicates the power the player once had.

During a champion’s REPLENISH phase, players may elect to temporarily substitute active dice for one or more of five black dice. Each of these dice specialize in one of the five other glyphs. Four of the sides have a double-glyph of the die’s specialization. Be warned, however, for the other two sides have the Destruction Glyph. Any time the Destruction Glyph is rolled, the die is immediately locked in (can’t be rerolled), and the original die that was substituted for the black die is trashed. Once the black die has performed its function that activation, it is returned to the general stock and players regain the die that was substituted (assuming it wasn’t destroyed).

Name: Glyph: Villains Champion
Description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: Villains further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a trio of devilish characters: the Soul Eater, Blood Mage, and Ice Witch.

Description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: The Seer further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a the Seer, a hero with no combos of her own but the devastating ability to see into the future to better turn the tide of battle for your side.
